definition: to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: The Rose pink clay will make the skin feel fresh and moisturized.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰粉泥將使面部的肌膚倍感滋潤和清新。

sentences.english: OCD patients feel compelled to repeat behaviours such as washing their hands.
sentences.chinese: 強迫症患者倍感強迫來重複一系列行爲，如重複洗手。

sentences.english: And so I am very grateful for his service.
sentences.chinese: 因此我對他的工作倍感謝忱。

sentences.english: Designed stripping pliers lightweight, comfort in use.
sentences.chinese: 剝線鉗設計輕巧，使用時倍感舒適。

sentences.english: This was a pressure cooker of a night for Johnson.
sentences.chinese: 對於肖恩來說，昨晚是一個倍感壓力的夜晚。

sentences.english: For the rest of our lives.
Japanese people say they take heart from such commendations.
sentences.chinese: 日本人說這些讚揚讓他們倍感鼓舞。

sentences.english: However, the public’s excitement is putting pressure on organizers.
sentences.chinese: 然而，公衆的熱情也使得組織方倍感壓力。

sentences.english: Helps the skin maintain a good balance of moisture, oil and acidity.
sentences.chinese: 有效調理皮膚，保持水油及酸鹼平衡，倍感舒適。

sentences.english: She caresses the Chen Yuan ground that lets get hurt considerately softly times feeling is warm.
sentences.chinese: 她溫柔體貼的呵護讓受傷的陳元地倍感溫暖。

sentences.english: It's a minute and a half of 10)intense thrills.
sentences.chinese: 這是一次一分半鐘讓人高度緊張，又倍感刺激的過程。

sentences.english: Dad getting home late, so Mingli feel lonely.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸回家越來越晚，讓明莉倍感寂寞。

sentences.english: Stigma and misinformation are rife. Treatment is expensive.
sentences.chinese: 患病倍感羞辱，錯誤信息盛傳，疾病治療昂貴。

sentences.english: Perhaps, in recent years away from home entertainment, makes me feel more truth of valuable.
sentences.chinese: 或許，這些年出門在外的應酬，令我倍感真情的可貴。

sentences.english: My car was full of dread , it made me feel so weak .
sentences.chinese: 車裏恐懼氣氛迷漫，使我倍感自己弱小不堪。

sentences.english: Front-tipping arc door is closer to your life while elegant radian reflect its fair shape.
sentences.chinese: 前傾式圓弧門體倍感親切，優雅弧度盡顯流暢之美。

definition: to feel/to sense/to have the feeling that/to think that/to move/to affect
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
